description: Set the distractions aside in write in a relaxing place of your creation! I've wanted something like this for years but I've never found anything with this level of functionality! Great work.

I'm using a very recent installation of Ubuntu 18.04. with no frills.
As somebody who spends quite a lot of time writing I thought I'd look at Focus Writer.

The first and the biggest problem for me is the US English Dictionary for spellchecking. Americans have a rather quaint habit of spelling a great many English words incorrectly. Attempting to change the spell check language led me to an "Add Language" button. Pressing this simply opened my home directory. Hardly helpful! I shouldn't need to go hunting the internet for a dictionary. Other apps supply a link. The website provided no help at all. Focus Writer may be translated into more than 20 languages! - but UK English is NOT one of them!

Second problem was the paper size. There was a wealth of paper sizes to select from a drop down menu. Unfortunately whichever I selected didn't change the actual desktop paper size. Changing from A5 to A0 had no effect. It appeared stuck on 'ANSI Letter'. I use A4 which is fairly standard in the UK.  Closing the programme and restarting also had no effect.

The third problem was that although the 'Page Setup' provided for large margins, these didn't occur and could not be changed on the desktop.

Fourth, I could not find a way to increase the screen 'Paper' size. Using ctl and + simply resulted in a '+' character inserted at the cursor. Increasing/decreasing screen paper size is something I do rely on.

Finally I read here that somebody had problems with the application not handling large numbers of pages and crashing. I've not tested that but since I regularly output between 100 and 250 pages, that was a concern.

I realise that this is a very lightweight application with very few frills and fancies. I also realise that the developer may have coded it for a later Ubuntu version rather than the version I'm using - so that may have caused some of problems.

The interface as is as promised, very clean and uncluttered. It is probably perfectly adequate for the American market as the very positive reviews here prove. Unfortunately, it is of no use to me and I will have to continue using 'Only Office'.

I would guess that many people, including the developer would say to me that I should stick with a proper word processor. I can accept that. I just wanted to give Focus Writer a chance.

If somebody subsequently can point me to a button or something that I've missed where all or most of the above problems are solved I will very happily change my review. I don't like to, and I very rarely leave a bad review, especially if lots of people are giving good reviews.  I often accept that the problem is either me - or my computer!

Thanks for reading this far.

Thisisi
summary: Lots of little problems that add up to a big NO!

description: FocusWriter's power lies under the hood. When you're touching the display edges with the pointer, it shows helpful tools bringing structure in your writing work like day-per-day statistics or a timer. You can configure the look of FocusWriter until it really fits your needs. If you have many texts to write, give FocusWriter a try. It is worth using.
summary: Simple but helpful environment for writing long texts

description: I suggest to download this app as a utility because it can always be helpful.
FocusWriter is really simple and powerful editor. Personally, am not a fan of statistics or dialy goals, but someone may find these options very useful. Works well with Wayland, too.
summary: One of the best distraction-free tools I ever used

description: This isn't a bad app to be honest, the ODF compatibility is mostly on part with LibreOffice. Alas, that doesn't reflect in a fully formatted document, often not showing headers, bold/italicized font work, etc. Aside from that this is a rather great writing tool that does as it is set out to do.
This application has everything, what ones needs for fiction writing. Excellent piece of work.
A great little writing utility, nothing too much and nothing too little.

I don't normally go in for this sort of thing, but I gave it a shot and I was far from disappointed. The interface is easier on the eye that LibreOffice or Word, and the customization allows you to adjust the skin for writing at night, which is great in combination with flux or Redshift for working at night. Great for casual writing. Would give 6/5 if I could.

However, 

P.S don't forget that ctrl+m is minimize, because I couldn't find any other way to switch applications while using it without shutting it down (but maybe that's just me).

The interface is not simple, as promised, bu childish. Available backgrounds and configuration options are sub par. Application steals MIME type bindings for a wide range of document types that it should not ever steal without the user explicitly configuring them for this application, like LibreOffice documents.

Just discovered FocusWriter, thanks to Fedora Magazine.

After testing it for a few minutes I already love it.

A word processor for writers rather than people who need fancy formatting.

During my quick test it appears to have everything I need, including a Canadian spelling dictionary.

I highly enjoy the ole terminal style while do one hour writing, the design concept of Focus Writer is much better than what i thought when discover it.

Give a try!
one of a kind , nice interface

I would use FocusWriter daily if you could increase the font size and/or use system fonts (Ubuntu). I run a 4K screen and while I'm sure the letters are perfectly formed, they look like a Brownian Motion simulation ;>
summary: Love the Focus, Hate the Font Size

description:
great app
keep develeping

FocusWriter uses the open document format so it's compatible with other open source word processors. It goes full screen right away and stays that way, which is great if you're trying to focus on your work. My only wish is that I didn't have to change my screen resolution from 3200x1800 down to 1600x900 in order to make it usable. At the higher resolution the letters are small and the writing area is very narrow, less than 25% of the screen. The simple solution of changing my resolution makes it much better. If the developers were to change these 2 things I'd give it 5 stars.
summary: Great way to keep distractions at bay when writing

description: Like the simplicity and themes, but it cant handle many pages
I can't change font size. It would be great if added.
what i like about it ,and didn't find in more specialized apps, is the support for RTL languages and handles these languages so great, at least for Arabic.
For creative writing this is such a good tool. Being able to immerse so well into the writings is great.
summary: Been looking for something like this for a long time

description: Installed the application and defined a custom page size. Closed the dialogue to find the page hadn't changed size. Reopened the tab and sure enough my settings had disappeared. Tried this once again with the same results and so uninstalled.

This is such a great writing app, simple, fit for purpose, and you can create some very simple but slick themes with custom background images, fonts, and blurring and transparency options for the text page.

Very lightweight compared to a full word processing program, suitable for lower spec systems.
summary: Fantastic simple app, fit for purpose

description: cant find outline anywhere
summary: Dated it looks like its getting really old

description: Great little writing app for keeping you focused with no fuss. For those who struggle with the fonts size issue, go to format; heading and scale up this way. Easy workaround until they add fonts as an option.
Great but editing features could be improved
summary: Really like it but could have some more features

description:
If in doubt, create a theme in ~/.local/share/GottCode/FocusWriter/Themes or wherever your FocusWriter directory is with the following settings:

(You should previously install the fonts-hack package with the Hack font, or change it in settings to whichever font you want)

```
[General]
LoadColor=#222222
Name=Darki

[Background]
Color=#222222
ImageFile=
Type=0

[Foreground]
Color=#222222
Margin=65
Opacity=100
Padding=10
Position=1
Rounding=10
RoundingDisabled=0
Width=800

[ForegroundBlur]
Enabled=false
Radius=32

[ForegroundShadow]
Color=#000000
Enabled=false
Offset=2
Radius=8

[Spacings]
IndentFirstLine=false
LineSpacing=150
ParagraphAbove=0
ParagraphBelow=0
TabWidth=24

[Text]
Color=#ffffff
Font="Hack,14,-1,5,50,0,0,0,0,0"
Misspelled=#ff0000
```

For those wanting to change typeface, type size, "page" size and position, etc., it's possible but slightly unintuitive - go to "Settings | Themes" and create your own theme from scratch or duplicate and modify one of the existing ones. You can also change the background image and so on.

This app is fantastic for creative writing, and just gets out of the way to let you work. The various background make it very visually appealing. If you need a simple, relaxing writing program, I highly recommend Focus Writer

One of the best apps for Linux so far.

What i like the most is that i don't get distracted by other applications running on the background.
A great distraction-free editor. Contrary to some of the other reviews, if you edit the theme you are using, you can change the font family and size to suit your tastes.

Font size, font size, font size!
This feature should obviously have been implemented during development.
If it's implemented in a future version, that would be just perfect!
Havent even typed anything up on it yet and already I love it.
Works fine! Provides plenty of settings to create or customize your personal theme. Including font! (to someone in comments complaining about the font size).
summary: Great app for doing what the name suggests!

description:
Does what it says on the tin. Gives you a clean, full-screen environment that reduces distractions while writing. I appreciate the ability to use whatever images you like as a background -- gives your eye a place to wander, without getting sucked into something truly distracting. 

TIP
A lot of people in the comments have complained about the small font size or page layout -- you can actually change all of those settings by editing or creating a template.
Kudos to the team

The developer should provide at leaste one alternative theme specifically for larger screens, or even people with smaller screens that still want larger text and a wider edit area.

I was baffled when I first started the editor; my vision isn't great, and there seemed to be no zoom option, and all themes seemed to have the same tiny font, so I didn't guess that I could fix this myself by editing a theme.

Once I figured that out, though, I just made bigger versions of a few existing themes, and I've enjoyed using FocusWriter ever since.
summary: Great, once I made my own theme

description: Simple, elegant, great!
Really keep developing
please keep updating and upgrading all the time.

I did not go online, read the help files, etc; but I should not have to. You open a Word Processor and the first thing you do is adjust the zoom to your likeing/eye sight; well, not on the menu bars or the tool bars. 
Then you start typeing, and you see all underligned with red, so you look for spelling language, only shows one and I can cance or accept, nothing on how to add a language. 
1 star
summary: no zoom, no spellcheck language setting

description:
Reading other people's reviews, I learned hoy to make the letters bigger. 
The developers should still make it easiest. 
I still don't know how to change the dictionary, for some reazon the program thinks I wish to type in Arabic, which would be cool, only I don't have the IP to learn that languate.

Using Ubuntu 18.04

I read all the available reviews here and was impressed.

I downloaded the application and started exploring its hidden tabs and was impressed even more.

I started to write some text - basically a note to email to a friend, and found that I really liked the clean uncluttered way the screen is laid out.

Suddenly, a word appeared underlined in red, - as a misspelling. But I KNEW that the word was spelled correctly!

I checked the Spelling settings in the 'Preferences' folder - English US! 
But I am in Gt Britain and many US words have a different spelling (and pronunciation) to UK English words.

No problem? there is an 'ADD' button next to the installed language box!

I pressed the button, expecting to see a range of languages to choose from - but no! I was simply taken to the system home folder.

There was nothing in the Home folder files that contained anything that the 'Add' button would recognise.

I started exploring the most obvious folders. Finally, in the Home/.local/share/Gottcode/Focuswriter folder, I found four folders, one of which was named 'Dictionaries'.

I opened the 'Dictionaries folder and inside was a file named 'Personal', with 0 bytes in size. It was only the usual file where odd words are stored when not in the normal dictionary.

This is a huge NEGATIVE for me. I do write prolifically and although my spelling ability is good, mistakes do creep in. When we proof read our own work, we often "see" what we 'think' we have written, not what is actually written.

It is a great shame that for me anyway, at present, this wonderful application is only useful for jotting down short notes etc.


Please, if Graeme Gott (the software author) reads this, please, please, please add more dictionaries, especially the UK English version.

Thanks for reading this far

Thisisi
summary: A good application but with one major (for me) fault

description: I used it and can't change font size and couldn't find a close button
its too bad, the interface is a bit clunky and the font is very small.

I had been looking for a writing tool that wouldn't distract me or interfere with my thoughts with irritating red-colored underlines to flag off mistakes and all that irritations. And then I stumbled upon this gem. And I have never ever looked back even once ever since.
 Bye, M$ Word!
A really nice simple WP, completely ruined by not being able to read the text.
summary: Font size; font size; font size

description:
Basic and pleasant with decent features. It reminds me of a more artistic version of Byword on the Mac.

For those that think you can't adjust the font size, you can. You just have to duplicate and then edit a theme. Yes, it is a bit of a pain.

DEVS: Adjusting font size really should be on the main toolbar. Aside from that, very nice.

Would definitely use it if it had the options to use different fonts and if we actually had the option to zoom in and get a closer look at what we're typing. As of now, it has potential, but fails to offer any real substance

And to all reviewers that wrote "We want to change the font" - you guys realise that you can create user defined themes with any font you want? ;)
Just sayin...
summary: Good idea, i will give it a try

description:
Focus-writer is wonderful.
I love this program.
For some reason the typewriter sound sooth’s me.
Now that I am using my old Lenovo keyboard again, there is no missing of the space bar or some of the lower keys like the “v” key.
The indent of the first line reminds me of the good old days.
I was terrible in high school typing class. I could only get two or three words out without making a mistake. Back then, the sound made me nuts. It seemed like everybody else just kept typing merrily along, and I was always stopping to correct.
Now I like it. It seems to keep me on track of the keys. It feels less “virtual”. Besides, these days there is the backspace key. No whiteout. How wonderful.
Today there are a lot more fonts to choose from other than Pica and Elite. Sometimes too many. Scrolling through the character offerings of Focus-writer, you can find some interesting ones, like Cherokee. Neat. When I stumbled across that one, I just wanted to dig into it. The dialog box even shows the meaning of each character. Some stand for more than just a letter, there is a set of English letters involved that make a sound. Cool.
Of course, the Ding Bat font is included. Who doesn’t need Ding Bats?
It seems also, that not all the keys sound the same when hit. It is a very slight difference. Other computer generated typewriter sounds used in the past just sounded static. Somehow Focus-writer got it right-- or maybe “Write”.
I may be typing more just because of this little open source program.
Paper in the clouds, (referring to the theme I am using), and tapping away. Oh yes, there are a few themes included, and you can also make your own. Nice.

Good to see this gem is now offered in the 'Software' app for Ubuntu 'Budgie'. Pretty much what everyone else said. The ability to drag-and-drop in the left menu is priceless. TYPEWRITER SOUNDS ARE NECESSARY! Ok, maybe not, but this added feature is a cadence for old-school writers like myself. Reminds me of my high-school typing teacher...Can we get auto-capitalization for sentence-case typing? No? Still love it.
Less distractions mean more focus on content.
That type-writer sound - literally, music to my ears!
This is perfect for a 'focused' writing session. I also love the typewriter effects.

The normal font size is too small, as far as I can see the only way to increase the size of the font is to use the 'Headings' setting which is far from ideal, particularly as I transport and edit documents from different apps.
summary: No way to change font size

description: For those of you frustrated with being unable to change fonts - you can. Go to themes, click "duplicate theme" and then "edit theme" - ez peazy.
summary: Dead simple. Gets you to write

description:
You may have to use this in a second desktop if you try to
Configure the printer!

description: App which lets you focus on your toughts.
summary: Just what is intended to be

description: Sehr praktisch, wenn man ein Writer ohne jegliche großartigen layout veränderung benötigt.
Danke hilft mir sehr.

Beim Öffnen in Libre Office Writer und ebenso nach Umwandlung in einem pdf-Konverter wird die Überschrift 1 in gleicher Formatierung dargestellt wie ein Text mit Formatierung Überschrift 2.
(Die Funktion "Exportieren als" fehlt)
sehr gut mit einem Projektor für Präsentationszwecke.
Superb zum schreiben. Ich liebe die Schreibmaschinensounds... inspiriert mich irgendwie.

Muy buena app para escribir sin distracciones

:-)
Se pueden usar los diccionarios de libre office para el corrector.

description: EVITA DISTRAERSE AL ESCRIBIR, MEJOR QUE OTROS PROCESADORES

Esta simple y gratuita app permite enfocarse en su trabajo, sin cosas complejas solo lo que requiere el escritor. Ademas cuenta con una opcion para simular el sonido de una maquina de escribir simplemente genial.

La mejor herramienta para poder escribir sin distracciones. Sólo la pantalla en negro (una vez configurada) y tu inspiración. Cumple con su propósito más allá de lo esperado. Si quieres focalizarte en escribir, ésta es tu herramienta.
Fácil y sencilla, y eficiente que te mantiene plenamente centrado.

Es para escribir y escribir. Muy recomendable. El único defecto que le encuentro, en lo personal, es que no tiene corrección ortográfica en español. Tal vez si la tenga, pero no se la he encontrado hasta ahora.

genial app... genial para escribir , muy facil de usar
tiene todo lo que necesito..
muy buena!!
lo tengo pendiente en donaciones..
(12 meses, 12 donaciones)
:-)
summary: genial app... genial para escribir , muy facil de usar

description: Pour écrire au fil des pages, avec une certaine élégance et une légéreté permise par l'interface minimaliste. Pasconseillé pour faire un document bureautique.

Pour ceux qui ont la passion des mots, cette envie d’écrire, de poser quelques mots sur de superbes images, photos…
Je recommande, c’est une merveille.
And you end up with English only dictionary without easy way to add another language. Uninstalled.

Très jolie interface, mais je n'ai pas trouvé comment changer la taille des caractères trop petits pour mes yeux, ni comment choisir la police. 
C'est dommage car le document peut-être exporté dans un nombre suffisant de formats.
summary: Manque de choix police et taille des caractères

description:
Прекрасное приложение.
Конечно я бы многое в нём доработал, но тем не менее - лучший.
Советую сразу лезть в настройки - там многое можно сделать удобней и красивей
Сразу идите в настройки и подгоняйте под себя этот инструмент писателя, ты и книга, всё остальное не важно
summary: Фокусироваться на написании книг! Именно то что нужно

description: Для потока мыслей в текст самое оно.

Интересно оформлено. Оригинальная идея для тех кто не хочет отвлекаться на лишнее. По умолчанию занимает весь экран, но можно поменять. Простое. Думаю будет полезно начинающим, детям или пожилым людям
Неплохо, только орфографию не проверяет и словари не устанавливает. Похоже, если и пользоваться, то брать не отсюда.
Самая удачная вещь - работа с эпизодами, возможность легко их переставлять, объединять.
Минимализм - (это) минимализм.
Не разобрался с изменением шрифтов в темах, пришлось создать пользовательскую. А так, все отлично. Спасибо разработчикам.
Как будто снова в винду старую наступил. Можно и картинку получше сделать, и настройку начальную, и т.д., и т.п.
很简单，但是，，如何调整字体大小啊，，，我快看瞎了
summary: 很简单，但是，，如何调整字体大小啊，，，我快看瞎了

description: 一款聚焦写作的小软件，界面漂亮，功能齐全，多数能自定义。但正如上面那个评论所说的，无法调节字体大小，在1080P分辨率下文字很小，辨识不易。我的解决方案：debian10.1中，显示选项选择200%scale，屏幕放大2倍，使用它刚好。其实有个跟它很类似的软件Typora，但有些功能Typora没有它好用。
确实很有feel，不过这个字体的渲染也太让人难受了，影响心情。然后如果有人不知道怎么改字体的话，可以到官网看一下。我知道的方法是到设置那里找到主题，然后选择“副本”，这样就可以修改默认主题了。也可以完全自定义一个主题，里面就可以修改字体。
cant type chinese in the program
